gurmukhi: dYq Gny rn mwih hny liK sRon sny kiv ieau mnu cIno ]
transliteration: Dait Ghane Ran Maah(i) Hane Lakh(i) Sron Sane Kav(i) Io Man(u) Choono||
translation: Seeing a large number of chopped and bleeding demons, the poet feels in his mind;

gurmukhi: ijau Kgrwj bfo Aihrwj smwj kY kwt kqw kir lIno ]36]
transliteration: Jio Khagraaj Bado Ahiraaj Samaaj Kai Kaat Kataa Kar(i) Loono||36||
translation: That Garuda had chopped the snakes into bits and thrown them helter-skelter.36.

gurmukhi: dyvI mwry dYq bhu pRbl inbl sy kIn ]
transliteration: Devoo Mdare Dait Bahu Prabal Nibal Se Koon||
translation: The goddess killed many demons and made the strong ones weak.

gurmukhi: ssqR Dwr kir krn mY cmUM cwl kr dIn ]37]
transliteration: Sastra Dhaar Kar(i) Karan Mai Chamoond Dhaal Kar Doon||37||
translation: Holding the weapons in her hand, she made the forces of the enemy run away.37.

gurmukhi: BjI cmUM mhKwsurI qkI srin inj eIs ]
transliteration: Bhajoo Chamoond Mahkhaasuroo Takoo Saran(i) Nij Oos||
translation: The army of Mahishasura ran away and sought the shelter of its king.

gurmukhi: Dwie jwie iqn ieau kihE hinE pdm Bt bIs ]38]
transliteration: Dhaae Jaae Tin Io Kahio Hanio Padam Bhat Boos||38||
translation: It told him after running that twenty padam of the forces had been killd.38.

gurmukhi: sun mhKwsur mUV mq mn mY auiTE irswie ]
transliteration: Soun Mahkhaasur Moond Mat Man Mai Outhio Risaae||
translation: Hearing this, the foolish Mahishasura was highly enraged.

gurmukhi: AwigAw dInI sYn ko Gyro dyvI jwie ]39]
transliteration: Aagiaa Doonoo Sain Ko Ghero Devoo Jaae||39||
translation: He ordered that the goddess be besiged.39.

gurmukhi: bwq sunI pRB kI sB sYnih sUr imly iek mMqR kirE hY ]
transliteration: Baat Sounoo Prabh Koo Sabh Sainah(i) Soor Mile Ik Mantra Kario Hai||
translation: Listening to the words of their king, all the warriors together took this decision.

gurmukhi: jwie prYN chUM Er qy Dwie kY Twt iehY mn m`iD kirE hY ]
transliteration: Jaae Darain Chahoon Or Te Dhaae Kai Thaat Man Maddh(i) Kario Hai||
translation: That with firm determination in the mind, the goddess be attacked from all the four directions.

gurmukhi: mwr hI mwr pRkwr pry Ais lY kir mY dlu ieau ibhirE hY ]
transliteration: Maar Hoo Maar Poukaar Dare As(i) Lai Kar(i) Maid Al(u) Io Bihario Hai||
translation: With swords in their hands, and uttering loud shouts of “Kill, Kill”, the army of demons swarmed from all directions.

gurmukhi: Gyir leI chUM Er qy cMf su cMd mno prvyK pirE hY ]40]
transliteration: Gher(i) Laoo Chahoon Or Te Channd Su Channd Mano Parvekh Pario Hai||40||
translation: They all besieged Chandi from all the four sides, like the moon encircled amongst clouds.40.
